name: Thunder Compute
headline: Virtualization software to make GPUs 5x cheaper
description: GPUs are in extremely high demand for AI development. A single GPU server can cost up to $300K. Despite this, GPUs in data centers are only utilized an average of 15-20% of the time. Thunder Compute is building technology to increase GPU utilization from 15-20% to 90%+, meaning that each GPU can be shared by 5x as many developers as in data centers today. Our technology achieves this efficiency gain by allowing all of the servers in a data center to share a single pool of network-attached GPUs rather than physically attaching a GPU to each server. Try Thunder Compute at docs.thundercompute.com/quickstart

founders.name: Carl Peterson, Founder
founders.description: CEO of Thunder Compute, formerly Management Consultant at Bain

founders.name: Brian Model, Founder
founders.description: CTO of Thunder Compute, formerly Quantitative Developer at Citadel Securities

generated_description:
### Thunder Compute: Making GPUs Accessible

**Overview**  
Founded in 2024 and hailing from Atlanta, GA, Thunder Compute is on a mission to revolutionize GPU accessibility through virtualization. In an era where AI development is exploding, Thunder Compute's team of three aims to tackle the high costs associated with traditional GPU setups and inefficient usage in data centers.

**The Problem**  
Many developers are aware that a single GPU server can cost upwards of $300K, yet those GPUs are only utilized about 15-20% of the time. It’s a glaring waste of resources. Thunder Compute has identified this inefficiency and is stepping up to transform it.

**The Solution**  
Thunder Compute's technology enables data centers to pool GPU resources instead of tethering them to individual servers. This allows for a staggering potential boost in GPU utilization—from a mere 15-20% to over 90%. By sharing GPUs among multiple developers, each GPU becomes effectively five times cheaper for users, making powerful machine learning capabilities accessible to a wider audience. The company’s approach saves users up to 80% on GPU costs, which is something anyone dabbling in AI will appreciate.

**Pricing and Offering**  
With competitive pricing, Thunder Compute offers attractive hourly rates for leading GPUs—like the NVIDIA Tesla T4 at just $0.27/hr and the A100 (40GB) for $0.57/hr. Users can quickly set up and manage GPU instances through a straightforward command-line interface (CLI), which makes onboarding fast and intuitive.

**User Experience**  
Customer feedback underscores the satisfaction with Thunder’s ease of use. Users have reported significant cost savings, stating that transcribing extensive data only cost them around $6—an exemplary case of Thunder Compute delivering on its promise.

**Team and Support**  
With a compact yet focused team, backed by Y Combinator’s Batch S24, Thunder Compute is primed for scalability. Under the mentorship of Aaron Epstein, the company is deftly navigating early-stage growth and product development.

**Get Involved**  
Interested parties can try Thunder Compute at [docs.thundercompute.com](https://docs.thundercompute.com/quickstart) or explore their offerings on their main website [thundercompute.com](https://thundercompute.com).

**In Summary**  
Thunder Compute is not just about providing cheaper compute solutions; it's about democratizing access to AI's most powerful tools. If you’re into AI development and looking for an efficient, cost-effective platform, Thunder Compute is certainly worth exploring.
